icarus.reactor

Class Reactor

  • java.lang.Object
    • icarus.reactor.Component
      • icarus.reactor.MajorComponent
        • icarus.reactor.Reactor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Reactor
extends MajorComponent
implements java.io.Serializable
    The nuclear reactor, evaporates water to steam as part of the boiling water reactor model.
    Author:
    Team Haddock
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Reactor

        public Reactor()
        Primary constructor for use when initialising a new game

      • Reactor

        public Reactor(int rodHeight,
       int activity,
       int steamLevel,
       double temperature,
       double pressure,
       double waterLevel,
       double radius,
       double waterSurfaceArea,
       int height,
       double failProb,
       int fix,
       boolean functioning,
       boolean repairal,
       int fixingProgress)
        Constructor used when testing or loading a Reactor from a saved state.
        Parameters:
        rodHeight - is the height the rods are at, out of 100
        activity - is the level of activity in the reactor
        steamLevel - the amount of steam in the component
        temperature - temperature of the steam in the component
        pressure - is the pressure of the steam in the component
        waterLevel - the amount of water in the component
        radius - is the radius of the container
        volume - is the volume of the container
        waterSurfaceArea - is the surface area of the water, used for calculations
        height - the the hight of the container
        failProb - The (maximum) probability of a component failing
        fix - The number of timesteps required to fix a component
        functioning - Whether or not the Component is currently functioning
        repairal - Whether or not the Component is currently being repaired
        fixingProgress - The progress on a current fix

      • lower

        public void lower(int amount)
           throws InvalidRodsException,
                  MinimumRodsException,
                  ComponentFailedException
        Reduces the height of the control rods in the reactor
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to reduce the height by, as a value between 0 and 100
        Throws:
        InvalidRodsException - Thrown when amount specified is either negative or would force rods outside logical region
        MinimumRodsException - Thrown when the height of the rods attempts to exceed the minimum
        ComponentFailedException - Thrown if method is called when component is failed.

      • raise

        public void raise(int amount)
           throws InvalidRodsException,
                  MaximumRodsException,
                  ComponentFailedException
        Increases the height of the control rods in the reactor
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to increase the height by, as a value between 0 and 100
        Throws:
        InvalidRodsException - Thrown when amount specified is either negative or would force rods outside logical region
        MaximumRodsException - Thrown when the height of the rods attempts to exceed the maximum
        ComponetFailedException - Thrown if method is called when component is failed.
        ComponentFailedException

      • getRodHeight

        public int getRodHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the reactor control rods as a value between 0 (fully down) and 100 (fully up)
